titles.title: To amend the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Studies and Facilities Act to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to participate in the design, planning, and construction of the Alameda County Brackish Water Desalination Project for the reclamation and reuse of water, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.

term.name: Federal aid to water pollution control
Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 6/4/1998--Introduced. Amends the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Studies and Facilities Act to authorize the Secretary of the Interior, in cooperation with the Alameda County Water District, California, to participate in the design, planning, and construction of the Alameda County Brackish Water Desalination Project to reclaim and reuse wastewater and degraded groundwaters within and outside of the service area of the Alameda County Water District in California. Limits the Federal share of the cost of such project to 25 percent.
